newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: SPT posts 96 IAS loss on accounting moves.
newsitem.headline: SPT posts 96 IAS loss on accounting moves.

text.p: SPT Telecom a.s., the Czech Republic's main telephone operator, on Tuesday said it posted a 483 million crown ($16.7 million) 1996 net loss as the company made one-off moves to provision itself against structural changes.

SPT Chief Financial Officer Urs Kamber told journalists that the firm posted the loss, according to international accounting standards (IAS), due to one-time extraordinary charges of 8.757 billion crowns.
He said 1.752 billion crowns of this was taken as the firm prepares for layoffs and restructuring that should see SPT shed some 10,000 of its current 26,800 workforce by the year 2000.
He added that a 7.005 billion crown impairment charge was also recorded including "a reduction of the accumulated depreciation accounted for in the 1993 opening accounts under IAS".
"In light of our activities in 1996, I am pretty happy with the results" Kamber said.
SPT posted a 1995 IAS net profit of 4.83 billion crowns. ($ = 28.92 Czech Crowns)
